etymology.description: 刻(severe/harsh) + 薄(thin; ungenerous) = harsh and unkind; mean.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the idea of severity with lack of generosity to describe mean-spirited speech or behavior. Often used for cutting remarks or a hard, unkind attitude toward others.

examples.chinese: 他的话太刻薄(他的話太刻薄)，让人很受伤(讓人很受傷)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de huà tài kèbó, ràng rén hěn shòushāng.
examples.english: His words are too mean and really hurtful.

examples.chinese: 她从不对下属刻薄(她從不對下屬刻薄)，反而常常鼓励他们(反而常常鼓勵他們)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cóng bù duì xiàshǔ kèbó, fǎn'ér chángcháng gǔlì tāmen.
examples.english: She is never harsh to her subordinates; instead, she often encourages them.

examples.chinese: 刻薄的评论并不能解决问题(刻薄的評論並不能解決問題)。
examples.pinyin: Kèbó de pínglùn bìng bù néng jiějué wèntí.
examples.english: Cutting remarks do not solve the problem.
